name: Hotel Erasmus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights in Mid-November and found the Hotel Erasmus to be a great place to stay in Bruges.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in the heart of Bruges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Good points:
reviews.title: Acceptable but Not Worth Glowing Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is recently redecorated and all rooms are of a high standard.
reviews.title: Good Location, Great Staff, Great Beers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect - Bruges is not a large city but you could get to Markt in 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Great place stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: The room was very spacious with a large bathroom, powerful shower and air conditioning.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The perfect central location right in the center and a short walk to the main square & sites, which was very important to us as we were only in town for 2 nights and wanted to see and do all we could. All the basic modern clean facilities (elevator, bathtub with shower in a large bathroom, comfortable good beds) -- at a reasonable price. Not your old Bruges, antique-filled, atmospheric kind of place -- but very pleasant contemporary accommodations. We didn't eat dinner in the restaurant downstairs because we were out walking around in the evenings, but the menu looked very good. The owner, Tom, is a very nice man who tries to be helpful and, in fact, did help us out repeatedly by making site-seeing suggestions, providing a discount card for museum entry (and saving a couple of Euros matters for us Americans these days)i, helping us out when our cell phone charger didn't work, calling us a taxi, etc. etc. He's a fan of Marvin Gaye -- who lived in the nearby coastal town of Ostende towards the end of his life (who knew?) -- and there was a special Marvin Gaye menu posted in the restaurant. that looked like fun. We very much enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Very Central, Clean & Pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Some friends and I used this hotel for just one night. We arrived on cycles and had been specifically told by Tom, the manager, there would be somewhere to store them. On arrival Tom was not there and his representative told us there was no indoor space and we ended up locking them to railings outside, not very secure for valuable bikes. When she called Tom after our protestations he said that we had been told the space would be outside - not true. I had read reviews (and the hotel advertised) the myriad of beers available, so I was kind of expecting a thriving bar. But there was no draught beer available to us thirsty cyclists and the bar was closed (this was around 7pm). In the end I went behind the bar with the receptionist, who did everything it seemed, and chose some bottled beer myself. This hotel was very well situated, as others have said but is let down by staff lacking in professionalism together with an owner who is somewhat Basil Fawlty like (he spent 10 long mins the next morning explaining that he was unable to open the bar because he couldn't get the staff, given their holiday requirements) On another occasion all might have gone perfectly well but in my experience this is a hotel to avoid.
reviews.title: Good location but poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay. We stayed here in June of 2007. Family of 4 - me, my wife and 2 sons ages 11 and 7. Stayed in one room that accommodated all of us that was very clean and well kept. We were able to stay in the back of the hotel with a great view of the canal. Within walking distance of all of the great sites. Hotel management was very curteous and accommodating. Very good beer available at the hotel, but did not try the restaurant because of the "pickiness" of our kids. Found good food a couple of blocks away from the hotel in the main square. Would definetly stay here again. Only down side was parking was a couple blocks away. Very diffciult to unload and load in front of the hotel (on a busy street).
reviews.title: Great location - very good for family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and enjoyed the central location, the clean rooms, and the breakfast.
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of a spring special that was being offered and this was a GREAT deal with a nice hotel. The location was convenient to everything and off of the main square and quiet. The staff was friendly and there was a lift so that made it easy to get our bags up to the third level. The room had a great view and despite being on the street, was quiet. The breakfast in the morning was very good. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, location friendly and great view from the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We experienced our Erasmus as a well located and nice hotel. Very friendly staff, nice room, great bathroom and good breakfast. We experienced some troubles with the heating and one of the beds, both were solved fast. Only remark is the beds: we had two seperate beds, which were (too) small and (too) hard for us. Nevertheless a recommendation!
reviews.title: great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This family-run inn has extreme proximity to tons of restaurants, shops, and a one minute walk to main square. The owners are always on hand and have a very elegant restaurant with about a dozen local beers on-tap. On our last day they even gave us bills in exchange for our change so we could exchange the bills before coming back home. The room was huge with one whole wall of windows that opened out into the street for an amazing view. Of the 9 hotels we have stayed at in the past 3 years in europe, none has been as nice and such a great price (about 90 euro/night).
reviews.title: Best hotel in Brugge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a retired couple; one of us uses a manual wheelchair. The manager, Tom, was helpful and honest when we contacted the hotel to confirm suitability - there are no specifically adapted rooms, but he was aware of the issues and recommended a room, which was very clean and comfortable with a canal view. Best to enquire individually as it may not suit all wheelchair users. Wheelchair only just fitted in lift with footrests removed. Breakfast was expensive but good quality and excellent service. Likewise dinner - perfectly pleasant but not exceptional, made enjoyable by excellent service. Amazing range of beers!
reviews.title: Sincere welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Erasmus' strengths are its location and its outstandingly hospitable and knowledgeable staff. We will definitely make it our base for any future visits to Bruges.
reviews.title: 5 star service with great host & staff

likes.liked: — Great 5 star service and comfort & considerably cheaper than 5 star chains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We were two female florists visiting on business and pleasure for 3 nights. I had stumbled on the hotel via various links and was so glad to have. The reviews were good, and it lived up to everything everyone says. The place is absolutely spotless, the maid works very hard within this hotel as do the waiting staff, who are all very loyal to their boss.
reviews.title: Clean, accomadting small hotel with lovely manager, Tom

likes.liked: — Felt like everything I needed was available and nicely designed set-up for comfort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel Erasmus for a romantic weekend break in Bruges after reading the good reviews on TA.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

likes.liked: — location, views, service and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would echo past reviews: The staff were very accommodating. We arrived at the hotel about 11.30 AM after travelling since 3.00 AM and check in wasn't 'til about 2PM but the staff were very helpful and found a room for us. We were really pleased as we were shattered! The only downside was that the huge double bed was actually 2 singles pushed together and there was a bit of a gap between the two (not ideal for the aformentioned romantic break!). I felt that I couldn't really complain about this as perhaps it was the only room that they had available. It certainly didn't ruin our stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were modern, airy, clean and well designed. I loved the wide screen TV complete with BBC1 BBC2 and ITV. The only minus was the disconcerting, practically see-through door to the bathroom. You could actually wave to your loved one on the toilet if you so desired (-not that I did)! Being an up-tight Brit, I swiftly put a blanket up against the door (thanks to a heads-up from another TA reviewer).
reviews.title: Well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is fantastic as were the views. One night we ate in the restaurant and the food was tasty and the restaurant well decorated. The waiting on staff were able to recommend some great beers to go with our meals. They also went out of their way to make sure something vegetarian was on the menu for me.
reviews.title: Great hotel for reasonable rates! Don't miss the restaurant!

likes.liked: — Comfortable room with a great people watching view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: The manager Tom was very attentive and tried to build up a rapport with us during our stay. He more than happy to furnish us with any info we needed on Bruges e.g. recommending veggie restaurants, opening times, booking taxis, maps and also booked restaurant tables for us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Beer!

description: Hotel Erasmus is a small family-run hotel in the cultural center of Bruges. On the street level there is a gastro restaurant. With up to 16 beers on tap, Erasmus is known for its great selection and diversity of fine Belgian beers. Personal service and spotless comfort is the essence of Erasmus Hotel.
